value: Typical tiled walls in São Luís

Although it was founded by the
in 1612 and has also been occupied by the
in the past, São Luis remained a markedly Portuguese colonial city. The buildings with beautiful
(tiles) walls and the cobblestone streets of its well-preserved historic center have been listed a

by UNESCO.

The city is roughly divided in two regions, divided by a river of sorts:

value: São Luís proper with the center, Old Town and industrial and working class suburbs.
São Francisco and its neighbours, which comprise a newer commercial district, all urban beaches, and many new high rise apartment buildings.

São Luis is also one of those places that have a distinctive culture of its own - typical cuisine, popular traditions and festivals and lively
parties that make the culture of São Luis stand out among Brazilian cities.
Bus station some 8 km southeast of the center, close to the airport in Avenida dos Franceses 5073 - right north of the intersection with Rua Tres. Telephone

(and others) takes you pretty straight to/from the waterfront of Old Town. Taxi R$ 25 from rodoviaria (fixed price), 25-30R$ taximetro from centro (12/2013).

and others.
The train station is in a street named: Companhia Vale do Rio Doce - next to Avenida dos Portugueses - some kilometers south west of the center.
is the name of the company that operates the train.
Airport some 13 km from the centre. Domestic flights by Gol

value: leaves from right outside the terminal (follow the signs) every 25 minutes or so, and takes about 45 minutes to reach
in the city center (where you can hop on to get
the airport). Get off one stop after, on
for 10 minutes to get to the eastern edge of Old Town.
If the above bus is not about to leave, a faster way is walking for 10 minutes along the main exit from the airport. Keeping to the right you will see a
gas station. From here you take the bus
(or ask what other goes), pretty straight to the Old down, about 30 minutes. To get
the airport, a number of buses from the
terminal pass by the Shell station.
Taxis run at fixed prices, displayed at a table just as you exit fromluggage pick up: To Old Town R$ 30, to the beaches R$ 40.

Staying in the Old Town, most is walkable. There is a big bus terminal,

value: takes you to São Luís Shopping in about 15 minutes.

.

taxi from old town to calhau: 25-30R$ taximetro (12/2013)

value: (Lions Palace - seat of the Governor) - Av. Pedro II - Centro.
Museu Histórico e Artístico do Maranhão
(Stones' Fountain)- Rua Antônio Rayol, Centro, close to Mercado Central.
- Second oldest in Brazil but very modern inside - Rua do Sol, Centro
Centro de Cultura Popular Domingos Vieira Filho
- Considered the biggest azulejo-clad building in Brazil (3 floors), built in the late 1800s. - Rua do Egito, Centro.

(Sacred Art Museum) - The collection belongs to Arquidiocese de São Luís, composed by pieces made in the XVIII e XIX centuries, featuring the Mannerist, Rococo, Baroque and Neoclassic styles. - Rua do Sol, Centro.
Remédios Church and Praça Gonçalves Dias
- Built in 1719 on Gothic style, stands on Gonçalves Dias square, a beautiful vision. - Largo dos Amores, Centro.

These all suffer from an enormous tidal variation, - the sea reportedly recedes close to 1 km on some spots. At high tide there is no dry sand left. The most popular beach is
, -far nicer if you continue a couple of kilometers: The beach of
, covering a stretch of some 5 km, with plenty of simple bars and restaurants, and a broad sidewalk by the road.

value: - From 13 to 30 June - This beautiful folklore manifestation of Iberian origin is one of the highlights of the city's culture. It has been kept alive by the black people of São Luis and is performed by groups in costumes, telling a tale of a certain
through music, dance and theater throughout the city.

There is an art cinema in the Old Town, with a mix of Brazilian and weird imports.

The largest and most modern movie theatre
, with 10 showrooms, is at the São Luís Shopping, mostly showing Hollywood fare.

There are three malls in the city with one of them being in the historic part of town. There are numerous shops that sell souvenirs.
The city center´s main pedestrian mall is
, which has most shops but hardware and foodstuffs.

value: content=Real Italian style, probably the best in the state
price=Lunch R$ 20 per kilo, dinner a la carte

Maranhão has its own version of the

(nothing religious, it was the inventor´s name). It is pink and rather sweeter than the others.
Many small bars around Old Town, but quite dead on Sundays, when most action goes along the beaches. Another area is along the
. A third is on the beach of
. Night buses go past these areas every half hour on weekends.

content=Bar come club, mostly reggea, some live. Drinking on the street outside.
content=As big as it gets in this city. Forró. Also quite a party on the pavement outside.

Plenty of options within the Old Town, which is where most visitors wisely choose to stay. If you for some reason prefer a beach,
has many pousadas (no budget options), beach bars and a few restaurants.
There is a youth hostel in Old Town that also offers singles, doubles and family rooms:

value: price=Single R$ 25, Double R$ 40, shared bathrooms. This old time LP favourite seems to be pricing itself out.
price=Double R$ 25, also dorms and larger rooms.
content=Bright and clean, high ceilings. Shared bathroom. Kitchen. No breakfast.
price=Double with fan R$ 65, also air con.
content=Here people mostly pay by the hour, but you might use it in emergencies.
content=Nice rooms right on the beach, good food.
address= Rua do Giz, 129 - Praia Grande

directions= Located in a restored mansion in one of the most picturesque streets of the historic center, this hotel has comfortable rooms with air conditioning, internet access and its restaurant serves one of the best - if not the best pizza in town. Prefer the rooms that overlook the funds, because those facing the street can be noisy especially at night. english-spanish-french spoken, delicious breakfast
content=Nice rooms right on the beach, good food.
, upper end of Rua Ribeirão, R$ 9/kg, next day if you are lucky.

- Reached by an approximately hour long boat ride from São Luis. Timetables are not entirely stable as they depend somewhat on tides, bust mostly around 7 and 9 AM there should be a boat, R$ 10, with return in the late afternoon. Doublecheck at ticket office the day before.
